summary: The Women and Underrepresented Minorities in STEM Booster Act of 2025 aims to increase the participation of women, minorities, and individuals with disabilities in STEM fields (science, technology, engineering, and mathematics). The bill authorizes grants from the National Science Foundation to eligible entities for activities like online workshops, mentoring programs, internships, and outreach programs. The Act highlights disparities in STEM participation and retention rates based on gender, race, and sexual orientation, with an emphasis on addressing these issues to promote a diverse and competitive STEM workforce. It authorizes $15 million annually for fiscal years 2026-2030.
